top_categories.workout_context: Border Wars’s ga/al countryside, rolling gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Border Wars isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Border Wars rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Border Wars when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Border Wars’s ga/al rolling gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Border Wars. Make this intensity feel like home.
Border Wars’s ga/al rolling gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Border Wars — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The varied gradients at Border Wars reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Border Wars — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on ga/al rolling gravel.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Border Wars — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Border Wars’s ga/al rolling gravel delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Border Wars’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Border Wars requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on ga/al rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: ga/al countryside, rolling gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 65 miles of ga/al rolling gravel in GA/AL border.
